channel.title: russia on Moscow Migrant
channel.description: Recent content in russia on Moscow Migrant

item.title: Igor Yakovenko: Putin's Koschei's Needle is Located in Crimea
item.description: This publication is an accurate transcription of one of the episodes from the “7-40” series on Igor Yakovenko’s channel. All information is reproduced without changes, except for corrections of errors in the automatic transcription. I would be grateful for any indications of inaccuracies or discrepancies with the original. Good morning, dear friends! My name is Igor Yakovenko. Today is December 3rd. It is currently 7:40 in Kyiv, and one hour later in Moscow.

item.title: Am I to blame for this war?
item.description: No, I am not to blame. I see no guilt, I feel none. I’m told that a true Russian should repent for all the crimes committed by Russia against Ukraine. But I don’t feel any guilt, and here are my arguments. My entire being is against war, murder, and treachery. To avoid becoming a killer, I had to leave and rebuild my life from scratch. Starting over when you already have something to leave behind is difficult.

item.title: About
item.description: I’m from Moscow, living in Montenegro, moved here with my small family at the beginning of 2022. I don’t complain about life, living modestly, but have a job for now. I am constantly haunted by thoughts of why things turned out this way. Did we have a choice? Can we change something, and how? This will be the focus of my blog. It will be available in four languages - Russian, English, Ukrainian, and Serbian.
